author: sergeyb
msg: [CXF-5014] Do not split HTTP headers on the client side by default, to avoid unexpected splits and to be consistent with the way HTTP headers are treated on the server side

author: rhuijben
msg: On OS/X (and possibly other systems implementing F_FULLFSYNC), also ask the
hardware to perform a sync (like on Windows), instead of only syncing the
This matches how the sync works in sqlite and may cause a performance hit
when other data is waiting to be written in the hardware buffers, as most
disks only allow syncing the entire write buffer at once.
